intro: Terminalia latipes subsp. psilocarpa, commonly known as the African frankincense tree, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Combretaceae and is characterized by its smooth, grey bark and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers followed by woody, aromatic capsules that contain the resin used in traditional medicine. Its botanical significance lies in its unique chemical composition, including compounds with potential pharmacological properties. The subspecies is distinguished by its specific morphological traits and geographic distribution.
